website_summaries.verdict: The HyperX Cloud Stinger is one of the most capable wired gaming headsets you can buy for under $50.
pros: Strong audio performance for the price
cons: Weak in extreme low and high frequencies

customer_reviews.title: Best replacement for my favourite headphones
customer_reviews.text: After a number of years using a different pair I was hesitant to replace them until it was necessary. Spent a long time searching for a good for the price pair until I found these. Well worth it. Great clear audio for party chat on PlayStation and gives great all round audio for gaming. The mic being muted when it's raised is a great feature. The pads are also really soft, spent many hours raiding with them on and still comfy. Also useful that they plug directly into the controller as it gives freedom to move about and stay part of the chat whilst not losing signal like wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: perfectly priced with added quality over competition.
customer_reviews.text: Had many headsets for PC Gaming over almost 2 decades now and these are right up there with quality for price ratio. You will not be displeased if you decide on them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan O

customer_reviews.title: These are the worst headphone I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awful, I usually go for one of the cheaper chinese models, but thought I'd pay a bit extra for some quality, wow was I wrong, these are really tinny and terrible quality, the bass is virtually non existent and sometimes the sound goes distorted or drops out completely. Absolutely useless, I'm shocked at how bad they are given the brand, think I'll go back to the cheaper chinese models as these are just really really bad and not even worth a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Good value, would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones. You can get some real crap on here so I wanted a decent brand that didn't cost a fortune and these fit the bill. Decently heavy (but sturdy with it) they feel like they will last a long time. Sound is good, the cushioned pads work well and it's comfortable enough to wear over a decent gaming session. Comes with a splitter cable if you need it too. Can't comment on mic quality yet, but I like the way the Mike rotates up and turns off when doing so. Would buy again of needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Garlick

customer_reviews.title: I would buy these everytime.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic headset! The sound quality can be changed between stereo and 7.1. This has provided me with a totally indepth gaming experience. I particularly like the fact that the ear pads can be changed from leather to fabric so it doesnt matter what your preference is, its in the box! The microphone can be detached for when I am just listening to music or playing offine and there is a small cover piece to protect the connecter port in the headphones when you are not using the microphone. Having used some other Big Branded gaming headsets, I would buy this set everytime now. The quality is fantastic and they are incredibly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: lyno_987

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Headset
customer_reviews.text: Background: I've been using headsets for over 10years for playing PC games, listening to music & media consumption. Initially I used a TurtleBeach Wired set, then Corsair Wired, then Corsair Wireless. Review: This headset easily defeats those mentioned above. All had their plastic ear-hinge crack & shatter after extended use, hence the move to these metal-cup elastic style. Surprisingly these also have a much better seal around my ears than them, resulting in much less sound-bleed & a better overall experience. Cable is unnecessarily long, so I just left it tied up as it came.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of more expensive HyperX Cloud 2 before and hated them so much I returned them straight away as the directional sound was awful. However I took a chance on these and they're surprisingly good! Solid build, nice clean and sleek design, comfortable to wear and mic has a satisfying click and easy to adjust. The sound is great and mic clarity is good. Only downside is a volume slider instead of a wheel, hence only 4 stars. I would recommend these for gamers and more general use. More discerning audiophiles might want something higher tier but at this price point it does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Andyuk

customer_reviews.title: Headphones ARE BUILT well and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These Headphones Have surround sound and is very good for gaming with good treble for hearing footsteps, and bass is very good not mushy or dry like and not overly loud like MOST Medium priced headphones. People say mic is not the best But I Love it and it is Discord certified, No Echo Like SOME headphones too however that can also be software problems. PLEASE PUT HELPFUL IF IT WAS HELPFUL. thank you Very good for price
customer_reviews.author: Mert

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and unreliable product and company - Disgraceful!
customer_reviews.text: The earphones stopped working on the first set and these were replaced, however the replacement set were refurbished which rapidly deteriorated too. The left earphone works intermittently whilst the microphone makes it sound as if I'm in a washing machine. I have contacted the seller and the manufacturer on many occasions but they don't reply; extremely poor service. I have spoken with Amazon but they just refer me to the seller, so round and round in frustrating circles. My advice...Do Not Buy from this seller or manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: You are missing out!
customer_reviews.text: The "guys" were getting annoyed with my poor audio quality from my (and I might add, "not cheap") work headset during our online gaming nights - this put's that one to shame: *7.1 Surround sound is amazing *Mic quality is as amazing and is removable too "he sounds like a real person now" *Very comfortable, adjusts to many head sizes. *USB control takes away the need for PTT in games +Nice bag to keep it all in Recommend this with out a shadow of a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Merrigan

customer_reviews.title: Great headset for PC gamers ... Not so much for console gamers.
customer_reviews.text: Fits comfortably, feels great... Cool control box to control the chat volume and game volume separately and a 7.1 button that I'm yet to explore. Would be 5* but the control box doesn't work on PS4 so I can't mute my headset when I want to moan about my team mates out loud! Can connect to PS4 via USB or via the headphone jack in the bottom of the controller. Overall great quality, sound and comfort but the no mute option for PS4 has upset me. As well as the volume controls to lower the game and chat volume separately. All of these features are on that control box that isn't PS4 compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this headset for my PS4 on the 28th of June, it hasn't even been a month and the aux bit broke off. I went to pull the headphones out and the piece got stuck in the controller. The headset has no history of damages and was working perfectly fine. Great headset, good sound quality, a shame it didn't last long. Only lasted 6 weeks. I am disappointed at this product as it was recommended to me by someone who has a headset from HyperX too.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Speaking isn’t great but great for immersive gaming
customer_reviews.text: After my last set died, upon getting these the first thing my gaming bro told me was the sound quality wasn’t as good these don’t plug in the microphone jack, it’s all done through the USB This is great as less wires to mess around with, but the quality of your voice might not be fantastic. Saying that though, these filter out background noise nicely. This may be a problem if people sneak up on you whilst you’re wiping out those pesky aliens.
customer_reviews.author: JMANNIUS

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, functional, but with some flaws that really let it down
customer_reviews.text: Like the standard sound quality and the USB connector with the ability to plug and play my iPhone headphones (stereo jack) if I decide to use something lighter. That said, there are some drawbacks that make me wish I could trade them back in: - Heavy with a headband that's too loose, so the cans slip down your ears - The 7.1 switch just adds a tonne of hiss to the channel, it's useless - The microphone doesn't fold or move easily; it's just 'there' in the way all the time (though you can disconnect it) - Easy to knock the volume control accidentally and mute yourself Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: MR E.

customer_reviews.title: 2 pairs faulty
customer_reviews.text: So I've just recieved a replacement pair of these as the first one was faulty. As soon as I plugged it into my ps4 pad I noticed you had to move the jack until you could hear the sound. For 50 quid you would expect these to be alot better. The bee excellent 20 pound ones have lasted me alot longer than any pair of these have. I would not recommend to anyone. Amazon's customer service is good with the returns and refunds. However they have to receive the faulty item back before they credit account or whatever. So now I'll be with no headphones. Just avoid. Buy the 20 pound ones
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Overall great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my boyfriend as he games often. We've had the headphones for atleast a year now and they are still going strong. We've only had an intermittent problem of a crackling noises but that went away and only lasted a couple of weeks-not sure if due to cable? We both use them and due to the adjustability they fit us both well and give clear sounds and the noise cancellation is pretty good too. Overall brill headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality - Amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, sturdy and great for long periods of gaming - at this price point, you can't beat it. The HyperX Cloud Stinger provides quality sound with a premium feel. Although the headband is made of plastic, it has flex, but not too much. You can also play for long hours whilst wearing this headset and for £50 (or if you pick it up for £30 on a sale like I did) there really is no better option. For long, comfortable, quality hours of gaming whilst on a budget - look no further than the HyperX Cloud Stinger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommanded HyperX because their headset survived for 2 years, whereas my old Corsair headset was already damaged after one year. It does look more durable, and you can change the ear pads! It sounds fine. The 7.1 surround effect on PC sounds a bit weird to me, but I haven't tested it thouroughly. I use it mainly with my PS4. The volume/mic control does NOT work with the PS4 unfortunately, so you'll have to adjust the volume and mute yourself through the PS4's UI. With the PS4, you can either plug it into the controller with the jack cable, or into the PS4 through USB with the volume control thingy.
customer_reviews.author: Raphaël Buquet

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort, good sound, useful extras.
customer_reviews.text: I found these surprising comfortable, even the headband does not annoy me after a few hours of use. The movable mic is extremely useful to either quick mute the mic or simply for when you don't need it. Plugs straight into the PS4 controller. What I did love is the fact these come with the adapter needed to to make it from a single plug to a double plug so I can also use it on my PC.
customer_reviews.author: L.Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Good headset for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant headset, not 5.1 but might aswell be. Has been really useful for fps games like call of duty mw. The direction of gunshots is easy to narrow in on and being able to hear which direction footsteps are coming from and to is brilliant. I've had some much cheaper headsets and some much more expensive and this headset deffinately stands up to the higher priced ones. The comfort is good so far and have had some 6 hour plus gaming sessions with these without an issue other than getting a bit of a sweaty ear. The Mrs doesn't like them much though because I can't hear a word she's saying which is a bonus for me.
customer_reviews.author: weggment

customer_reviews.title: ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Quality of this headphones is extremely high, it is build with a lots of details that made them very robust, cable and commands are great. I do not like that the microphone is not part of the headset, but you can remove, if you use it once a while is fine, but if you use it regularly, it is rigid once you pu ton so you cannot leave the headphone on the desk easily. Quality of sound is ok but not great compared to similar product, actually I have logitech g35 from more than 10 years and thought to have an improvement with a new headset, instead logitech remain a lots superior in terms of sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that comfortable with glasses
customer_reviews.text: I like these now but I did have to use a 3rd party app to make the mic more sensitive as my friends couldnt hear me at all. I also used the app to increase the bass a little bit. These are not massively comfortable with my glasses on either, so I just wear them the glasses at an angle which sounds weird but it works for me. This way the are not in contact with the head strap. I would say these are worth the money if you realise the above.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great headset.
customer_reviews.text: Got to admit these are a great set for games and movies. Replaced a set I had which have been great for several years and would have replaced with the same if possible. Technology moves on and I am so pleased with this headset so far. Not as much control over the sound as the old set but sound fantastic anyway. Great sound, fit and feel comfortable, even better than my Xtatic headset. Can't recommend then enough. Not an audiofile but appreciate good sound. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicad

customer_reviews.title: Had to return two within the space of 5 months, can not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this headset, but due to constant faults I had to leave it behind. My first issue was after around 5 months the braiding on the wire broke and now the cable was constantly folded in a bad way. I returned and got a replacement. I had the replacement for one week exactly and the mute microphone button broke. I’d press it, it would light up to show muted but it simply wasn’t muted. So at this point I gave up, returned again for my money back and got a different headset.
customer_reviews.author: mutchy126

customer_reviews.title: I use these daily and love them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these (HyperX Cloud Stinger) for work for Teams chat. I now ALWAYS use them playing my PS4, sound quality is really good and they're comfy when worn for multiple hours. Flicking up the mic to mute yourself is quick and easy and works really well. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K. J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect but the microphone sound quality is pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous model of HyperX for nearly 7 years!!! So it was clear to me to get the newest model from HyperX. The 7.1 surround sound has been improved a lot! Needed a few minutes to get used to it although the Dolby surround sounds a bit like you're inside a box so I don't use it. My old one's mic was really bad so instead, I was using my webcam's mic and this time was no different. So if you want a good mic this is not the one but otherwise, it's an all-around perfect headphone. Comfortable and supplied with an extra extension jack cable so I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: IndyScrate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset
customer_reviews.text: Having previously owned different brands of headsets , I decided to purchase Hyper X Cloud 2 Gaming Headset and buy far the most comfortable headset you'll wear . I opted to change the ear muffs to fabric than leather cause of the sweat , but other than that clear concise sound output and great for listening to music as well . Defo recommend it out there for a decent headset !!
customer_reviews.author: peej

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. Sound quality comes through very clear. The flip-up microphone works perfectly and all the described features as well. The headphones are connected to my Soundblaster ZxR external headset/mic hub. I contoll the volume and speach from there. If you want an overall solid, budget friendly and clear audio headset that looks good too, then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: I can only review this product based on my observations of my son’s usage, and his feedback. He loves them and says their the best he’s had. They certainly cancel out a lot of noise - I told him he could have a chocolate from the tree yesterday and he didn’t move, so there’s no way he heard. Also, given the way he hurls his headphones when he’s told to come off his gadget, I’d say this set is pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: ACE of Kingston

customer_reviews.title: Best headset I have every used!
customer_reviews.text: Best headset I have ever used! I had some initial problems with the volume of the mic and Kingston where superb with there help and support. I eventually discovered the problems were caused by a 3rd party 4-pole extension that I was using. I scrapped that and everything is clear again. The cable attached to the headset ends in a 4-pole connection which could be plugged straight into a port that accepts it. However it also comes with another lead that ends in a usb. On the other end is a small control board where you can control the volume to the audio and of the mic. I would highly recommend this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Steel

customer_reviews.title: Good for gaming at home
customer_reviews.text: They are quite good. The sound is lacking a bit comparing with Sony WH-1000MX3 but good enough for FPS games. Again it limits the surround sound around you but you still can hear what is happening around you. The ability to control volume on the right muffle is nice thing. Mic is of great quality and there is no distortion. At least I have been told by my friends
customer_reviews.author: Rudolf C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor and Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Although the headphone quality material isn’t too bad the actual sound quality is nowhere near as good as expected. Marketing material shows this as being a main selling point but it didn’t sound as good as a £5 budget earphone I purchased also. The quality is very tinny after about 60% volume. The headphone jack itself also snapped too so I was very disappointed overall. I wish I hadn’t of bought them because it’s fairly expensive for what you get. Maybe it was a faulty unit but overall I wasn’t impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Pascall

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend... break too soon for the money...
customer_reviews.text: Update: They broke very easily. The mic just stopped working so have dropped several stars. Our boy is really impressed with these. His favourite feature being that lifting the mic away from the face automatically mutes it. He says the sound is great and hasn’t had any problems. Would recommend. They’re well made and seem to be holding up to treatment of a gaming fourteen year old.
customer_reviews.author: Tan

customer_reviews.title: Ok to begin with....
customer_reviews.text: After opening I realized the sound quality wasn't great but they didn't require a battery so I was pretty chuffed with them, the actual build is robust and I still use them for sound but about three months in the mic started to cut out and I'd have pull out the cord and put it back in, 9 months after purchase the mic no longer works for game/party chat but inexplicably works on other devices, ultimately disappointed with the products overall life span, I suggest paying a bit extra for better sets.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: good for casual use but best when it’s game time
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hesdset about 1 mount is so nice and clear I have used it for gaming and music producing and its so good for both of them its something deferent trust me its worth it its have nice packaging and best quality of sound and its build so well but if you like to use to go out its not really comftable around your neck and mic sound quality is just so nice and clear so your team mates are can hear you so well
customer_reviews.author: mr x

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with my choice
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on headsets before settling on these cans. I'm very happy with my choice, they are great for long gaming sessions.. i've worn them for hours and hours without feeling any sort of strain on my ears or head, which is pretty rare. My only gripe is that the connection from the jack cable to the usb soundcard is quite a loose fit.. and if you have the dongle floating in the air off your desk then you probably will have the jack come out just enough to lose audio once or twice. I suggest just clipping the dongle to the bottom of your shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Changed my gaming/audio life
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing!! Super soft and comfortable, even with glasses on for a full day. Great audio quality and I love the versatility of them with the removable mic and audio card depending one what you use them for. I have them predominately in my PC, but have also used them with my PS4, Phone, Tablet and Switch. I've never really liked over-ear headphones, especially as I have a few piercings which can get a bit sore or irritated, but they are usually best for gaming. These have completely changed that feeling. I adore them and have raved about them to all my friends :)
customer_reviews.author: Helen Roberts

customer_reviews.title: good headset at this price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of gaming headsets over the years from the full function £200 turtle beach to £10 from HMV. These at around £40 I'd say look, feel and work better than many of the more expensive ones I've had. They are comfortable, volume level for chat and game is good and adjustable and the do block out other ambient noise although not with noise cancelling tech, just build quality. I use them for X BOX one X and they plug straight in to the controller with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Haleblade

customer_reviews.title: First rate gaming headset!
customer_reviews.text: I got this headset for PC gaming initially but was so impressed I bought a second as a Christmas gift for my nephew who games on an Xbox One The sound quality is fantastic.. playing games like Battlefield1 I can clearly hear what's happening around me, including enemy troops coming up behind or close to my position :-) The mic quality is good too.. a handy feature is the mic flip on/off depending if you have the mic raised up (off) or pulled down to speak (on). Another great feature is how well they block out other sounds (you can't hear anyone talking near you). I also find them comfortable to wear for several hours at least
customer_reviews.author: Sir Galahad

customer_reviews.title: All Good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance for the money and seemingly strong enough build quality. The reason I've given it 4 stars though is because I'm not too confident in the cable. It's not that it's particularly flimsy but more that it's moulded to the headset, so if you roll your chair over it a few times, or trip over it etc. you will have to go buy a new headset. Not a complete nightmare for people who are careful and/or own a soldering iron but I no longer do and have killed headsets before in the above manner. So in summary, it is a really excellent headset. Just don't be clumsy, you naughty little sausage.
customer_reviews.author: Diarmuid Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and clear mic.
customer_reviews.text: Used for playing Rainbow 6 after using desktop speakers and was suprised by what little things extra for could hear. This was within my budget range and pleased with the quality. I like that the mic is muted when flipped up. Came packaged well and very comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: These are good but not brilliant
customer_reviews.text: These are good but not brilliant, the sound quality isn't exquisite for something that costs ~£131, the problem is there is a loss of quality and sharpness when the volume is set to low and mid range on both the pc and through the soundcard (e.g the kawaap of an explosion). Setting the volume to max on the soundcard and leaving it at low to medium on the pc helps with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found for glassses
customer_reviews.text: So I've had this product for over year nd half now. And I have to admit I'm honestly surprised that they have lasted so long (I usually kill headphones fast) I can average about 4 hours a night with these and not once have I had an issue. One Main issue for me is that I wear glasses and trying to find a head set that doesn't put pressure onto them I found difficult but these do the job with out any pain or discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: shadowhawk2000

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming headset by far
customer_reviews.text: Bought to work for online gaming, the level of detail I can here is unreal, enemy footsteps are clear and can be pin pointed with accuracy making game play superb, I have this plugged in to a rode studio kit as well. I always leave my honest opinion on all purchases. If you like my review and it’s helped you in any way please give it a thumbs up 👍🏽 Thank you !!!
customer_reviews.author: Stevan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, decent microphone, has usb connector which works on both ps4 and xbox 1, sometimes when not in use for a certain amount of time can disconnect the microphone while using on the ps4, not sure why this happens but I just take the usb out and put it back in again which solves the issue, some noise bleed, which can be frustrating for others if they sit in close proximity, nice high end, ok mid range and deep lows nothing spectacular but for over-ear headphones with all the features that they offer at this price range I feel they are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: 4/5* bought 2... 3months of use before reviewing
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 minor flaws from an otherwise 5star product. Hitting the metal frame makes a big buzzing sound and the virtual surround isnt the best at market. But the memory foam is amazing ! Very comfortable. It has a minimalistic design and the black color completely mutes it making it easily usable and not flashy in public. Used it on really long sessions, over 4hrs or so, good quality build and sound, amazing noise cancellation. Caution: dont use more than 70% of volume, you might not hear the doorbell and oven timer.
customer_reviews.author: Joviii

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: After owning these for almost 2 years here is my opinion VS the Logitech G933. Sound quality: Hyper X by far. Comfort: Logitech. Features: Logitech. Durability: HyperX (excluding the horrid ear pads). Directional sound: Logitech. Overall I'd choose the Hyper X over the Logitech g933 so long as you get replacement ear pads every year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rees

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: At first I was looking for a good set of headphones, and HyperX makes some nice headsets but after listen to it Wow Very nice HyperX Cloud Revolver the bass and the sounds are nice also the 7.1 when I watch movies, & playing PC games. What more can I say that is already been said on the product. it lives up to it's name.
customer_reviews.author: I.D

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset on offer for £29.99, and it's a steal for that price. Great sound, comfortable earcups, lightweight and look good too. The mic on this headset isn't very good, but I understand that it's only to chat across networks, and not to create voice overs with. The single wire for the headset is very long and strong, and also comes with an extension/adapter to be used with a PC (my use for this headset), which is great. Would recommend this headset to those in the market for a cheap headset which is high quality.
customer_reviews.author: JAMIE B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. Iv had a pair for 4 years now and still working perfect. Iv ordered my second pair so my daughter can use my other ones. Such good Value for money. I use these for gaming on PS4 and watching movies. Sound quility is very clear and the bass doesn't take over the sound on the deeper sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G.

customer_reviews.title: Common fault
customer_reviews.text: Common issue with these is that after between 6-18 months they begin making a horrible static sound when you talk. I have had one replaced already, my friend has had 2 replaced and my other friend has also had one replaced. Seems to be a common issue with them but they replaced my friends even after 12 months so HyperX/Amazon must be aware that it is a fault.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieModo

customer_reviews.title: My son loved these headphones
customer_reviews.text: My son loved these headphones, great sound, great fit. We need to buy another pair though as he left them on the bed and the dog ate the microphone. We have tried another pair since but they were no where near as good.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Dockray

customer_reviews.title: Delightfully surprised
customer_reviews.text: Having got this delivered over the weekend I wasn’t sure what to expect from a gaming headset as various review ma have said that the gaming headset don’t have the same quality of sound as your typical headsets. Can honestly say the sound is amazing , having giving this a run through on PUBG and also a few classical songs , the sound on these are AMAZING and clear. The unboxing of these is pretty special as well, packaging is beautiful and the “extras” useful
customer_reviews.author: Herman Nel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mic for chat
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for gameing/and a good clear mic was also needed, this one fits the bill, I have no complains.... except for one teeney weeny one, The (bare) metal headband sounds aweful whenever it is touched, perhaps a thin plastic coating would help with this. This is not a deal breaker (for me), but it would take a 99% good, to a 100%.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: Headphones broke after 4 years of almost daily use - so I must say that really love the quality there. Left side stopped working without any reason but I can really recommend buying them for £50 (these days HypeX is much more expensive so the value/price is much worse. But nonetheless - great quality, good sound and very very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: I went from 10 years of being loyal to TurtleBeach and haven't looked back since.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for just over 6 months, last week my friends couldn't be in a party with me due to the horrific noise coming from my microphone. I listened to it myself and it was horrific, despite the HyperX customer service not being the fastest or the easiest to find, they managed to fix it within 2 weeks. That being said, when things start to break 6 months in it doesn't fill me with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming Headset.
customer_reviews.text: I'm coming from Logitech G933's and these are phenomenal. Lightweight, comfortable and functional. I mostly play CS:GO and these are perfect for the game. The only headsets that really compete with these for e-sports use would be the Sennheiser game series and HyperX's Cloud Alpha headset although it currently isn't available in the gunmetal series so I opted for this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Darkside Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace a cheaper pair of Logitech that had decent sound but poor quality build. I doubt I'll have a cracked arm with these, I'd need a cutting torch to get the headpiece to come off. Sound quality through the supplied USB sound card is clear and the speakers provide well balanced sound in everything I have tried. The 7.1 works well when it works well but in wow the sound goes very faintly tinny on some ambient noises Ridiculously comfortable headphones also. To say they feel so solid in the hand they rest on the bonce like a feather.
customer_reviews.author: R. TIttle

customer_reviews.title: I originally had the hyper x cloud 2....
customer_reviews.text: but I decided it was time for an upgrade. After having such a great time with cloud 2 I decided to stick with hyper X. So far from a day worth of testing, the cloud 2 sound is far superior. When testing the headset and going back to the cloud 2 It was clear that Cloud 2's sound was crisper. Furthermore, I've got a constant white noise/static coming from the new USB the headset comes with but doesn't occur when I use the old USB the cloud 2 came with. Personally, this could just be a problem with the USB soundboard. However, for the price, it is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: danny payne

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these headphones are amazing quality. My 12 year old daughter never has them off her head. Compared to the ones she was using before, these blind them in terms of sound quality and mic quality. Her friends can finally hear her loud and clear. Noise reduction works, I know this because I have to call her name 20 times now instead of just 10
customer_reviews.author: samantha atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Only negative 1st,sound for music using 7.1 mutes voice level slightly but very good on normal stereo.Gaming audio very good,listen for that enemy creeping up behind you.Generally sound is clear and bass is good. The build quality is good and the comfort at this price is outstanding.I have worn this headset for hours with no problems. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, connector broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, connector broke after 6 months, had warranty replacement that lasted another 7 months before failing again in the same place. nothing lasts forever but the connectors on these gaming headsets seem to just not last when the rest of the headset is still perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Simmyoto

customer_reviews.title: Awful microphone quality, people can hear YouTube videos back through the headset. Sound not bad.
customer_reviews.text: *Review for Cloud Stinger* Horrible. Microphone quality is tinny (worse than a phone microphone; that's how bad it is), sound is also tinny but better than the microphone. Friends on Discord can hear YouTube videos/music I play back through the headset, even at low volumes. Quality also feels really bad, especially on the cables, and it is not comfortable to wear at all. The ears squeeze inward too much which means the band is loose on the top of your head, meaning it moves backwards so you end up wearing the headband way too far back, putting more pressure on your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but too quiet.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and light, bit as the games I play using a headset are call of duty battle royale, where sound is so important, they just were not good for this. They were far too quiet. If it’s just for regular gaming where hearing enemy footsteps isn’t so important then I’m sure these are great. But I had to upgrade and when I did with the steelseries arctis 7, I’m so glad I did! Comfy, but just too quiet.
customer_reviews.author: ArsenicLungScoop

customer_reviews.title: Cheap connector bit! Just breaks off
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this and while the sound cancelling and comfort is excellent, the connection bit into my controller is awful. I pulled it out last night to use on my phone and the metal bit just fell off. No I didn’t tug at it, I just pulled it out. I now have a complete headset with a broken connector! I have had this a month and a half and am seriously upset. It’s not a cheap headset, and the returns only last for a month! Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Kim H.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: The 7.1 surround sound is amazing and works wonders in games, the quality of these headphones are top. I've owned them for over 4 years now and despite being scratched up and old, the sound quality is still amazing (compared the sound to newer headphones and found that it's just as good, and sometimes even better). These headphones cancel out noise extremely well and for the price, it is unbeatable. Even in 2019, and at this price range, these headphones are some of the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: Sorcus

customer_reviews.title: Mic is far too quiet
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a few weeks as it has some of the highest reviews but sadly the mic quality is not good at all. The volume is far too low even with all settings maxed. I tried a lot of troubleshooting, even with the manufacturer but ultimately couldn’t resolve the issue and returned the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Competitive gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headset, great sound quality and superb price for great quality, I'm yet to test the durability but that will take time, the build quality is very sturdy so it should last a couple years, it'a very comfy headset too I would recommend this for casual/competitive gaming
customer_reviews.author: Kobi

customer_reviews.title: A very decent headset. Happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the product for a couple of weeks, but so far the build quality seems excellent, the sound quality is very good, although when playing certain things quietly there is a small amount of noticeable static/feedback. This disappears as soon as I'm playing a game/music or something. It's comfortable to wear and blocks out a lot more noise than my previous headset, although this isn't what I'm aiming for. I use it as a headset for music/gaming/communications and it's very well rounded for all three.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy B

customer_reviews.title: Could do better
customer_reviews.text: Updated: I purchased the Cloud Stinger variant. Sound and mic quality are inferior to my previous £10 cheap headset; it's generally okay, but I was expecting better for the price. I've now had these for around 6 months and the mute function on the headset is broke, overall I am regretting buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Great audio quality, good audio control, good build quality. Detachable mic for those that prefer that. The main reason I went for these is because of the long cable length -- I can watch tv shows across the room. Cons: I really wish the audio control (on the cable) was higher up. At the minute it's practically on the floor when I'm sitting, so I always have to grapple for it when I want to change the audio quickly. My old headset had them in a much better position where it was more easily accessible. I also have pretty large ears so the firmness of the ear cups makes them start to hurt after an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: NINA

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and great sound!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very descent headset for the money. It's used for gaming and communicate to others online. Build quality is strong and adapter for separate line-in en mic is included. This extends the cable even more. Comfort is excellent, even after several hours. Easy volume slider on headphone itself to adjust sound. Microphone can be switched off by moving upwards. Packaging and delivery where excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Glades

customer_reviews.title: Lovely 7. 1 sound quality. As this is ...
customer_reviews.text: Lovely 7.1 sound quality. As this is a USB device ensure if you are running it on a PC that you go to ...Control Panel >Hardware and Sound>Sound....and in PLAYBACK and RECORDING tabs....RIGHT CLICK and ENABLE this device as default. As this item has its drivers built it, it is not enough on some PC set ups just to simply select it as your device....you need to set it as the default. Hope this makes sense. But sound quality and overall (I have gunmetal grey and game a lot) its fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service, 2 year guarantee, excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son in Nov 2015 and they have been brilliant. The microphone recently stopped working suddenly and when we got in contact with Kingston they asked for a photo and details and were fantastic in sending a swift replacement headset because of the 2 year guarantee. I am so happy with the customer service and with the great quality of the headset too. I would absolutely recommend this company and their headset.
customer_reviews.author: sapitt

customer_reviews.title: ... to replace poorly made Razer Kraken Pros Sound stage good Mic average (works well on Discord
customer_reviews.text: Top Class headphones bought to replace poorly made Razer Kraken Pros Sound stage good Mic average (works well on Discord, Skype, and TeamSpeak.) Build Great mostly metal Most comforatble headphones I have ever owned Great for those of us with big heads Razers fell to pieces in less than a year and I mean pieces Would definately recommend these I am a Gamer so dont really have audiophile experience but if you want that experience you will need to spen £100's more
customer_reviews.author: LLIAM MCCARRON

customer_reviews.title: ... still havent found a single issue with it very comfortable and amazing quallity
customer_reviews.text: Been using this headset for so long and still havent found a single issue with it very comfortable and amazing quallity. Good Points > Amazing Mic/Speaker Quallity > Very Comfortable > Very Well Packages > Comes With Handy Bag > Detachable Microphone > 7.1 Surround Sound > Brushed Aluminum Design Bad Points > When Mic Is Detached Wont Work With Android Phones. (Possibly a bug with my phone or headset's Drivers.)
customer_reviews.author: Alix

customer_reviews.title: Great headset for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Absolute bargin of a headset! I bought for gaming and the sound and mic quality is amazing! Some people are saying that all your mates can hear is themselves but I've had this for 3 days now and noone can hear themselves!! Great headset great price!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hyper X are at it again making an awesome product. They are super comfy and have tonnes of cable length which is great I also really like the surround 7.1 sound. Super durable. The only thing i don't know about is the mic as i have never used it as i have a blue yeti sat in front of me.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Burton

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my 9yr old to game with friends during lockdown, for an hour in the afternoon. After a few weeks the product is unreliable - sometimes it works, sometimes not which causes upset and sadness as he can't talk to friends. I have tried to use the sellers website which does not seem to be user friendly or recognise the product name when I input it for help.
customer_reviews.author: CMC

customer_reviews.title: Constant static noise
customer_reviews.text: When using the USB dongle, there is a faint constant static sound. Looked around for any fixes but seems to be an issue being reported by many but no fixes. The headset worked well when not using the USB dongle and used the 3.5 connector but as you are buying for the use of the 7.1 surround sound then its not worth getting this headset if it has this static. Also found the headset to not fit very well as it seemed a bit loose and would slip down from time to time and would rather have a headset which didn't need to be adjusted every time it would slip.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Shortall

customer_reviews.title: Great but might break
customer_reviews.text: Still my personal favourite gaming headphones but won't last forever Sound is decent and mic too and have lasted the longest but will always start to fail still the best BUDGET ones in my opinion very comfy too but will sweat in long gaming sessions
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Very good gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my partner for Christmas and he loves it (he originally had HyperX Cloud II). He says its very comfortable, fits just right (too big for my head, slips down over my ears & cant adjust) & surround sound is perfect (he plays CSGO). I would rate this 10/10 but the "one size fits all" knocks it down a point or two. If you are thinking of buying, I would recommend to try find one in a gaming shop where you can physically fit it on. If you are going to be spending this amount of money I would need to know if it fits right first
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Hyper durable and top quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought in November of 2015 and used almost daily for multiple hours since. Absolutely no issues whatsoever. The ear cups have minimal cracks now appearing so very pleased with this purchase. I’ll be getting some new cups for it and using it for another few years I’m sure. Definitely built to last!
customer_reviews.author: Brizzleback

customer_reviews.title: While I know of better out there
customer_reviews.text: While I know of better out there, not at this price. While I occasionally wear them to dull background noise, they aren't as isolating as my Bose headphones. Sound quality is again great for the price. I use these almost daily and long hours of usage does leave your head sweating which would be acceptable if the sounds didn't bleed the room and they did a better job of blocking out background noises. All and all, a great purchase at this price and excellent mike for gaming and conference calls
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Willard

customer_reviews.title: Great but it did break once.
customer_reviews.text: The product is brilliant when working. The only reason it got 3 stars is that it completely permanently died during a Discord chat even though it’s Discord Certified Approved Product. Amazon replaced it and it’s been working fine since.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Only had these a day but have to say they are fantastically comfortable. Worked all day listening to music on them and then tried them for a few hours on the PS4 in the evening and you almost forget you're wearing them. The sound is rich and clear to such an extent I found I was able to repeatedly turn them down to really quite low and still enjoy the sound. The only downside is they don't work with my Chromebook - though to be fair, they don't specifically claim to, still a bit of a disappointment. Other than that, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Morris

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-range gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: Solid, comfortable headset with a very respectable audio; good build and material quality. Sound is well balanced for both gaming and music/video. well cushioned ear pads and head pad make is very easy to wear for long periods of time, much more so than previous headsets I've used. The raise the mic to mute feature a useful one. Overall, a solid headset in the lower-mid price range, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nasher19

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Got them as a present for my husbands birthday. He loves them. Just to compare - I recently bought a different headset (was also amazon's choice) just 1 pound cheaper, but so much worse! Returning other one and will be buying Hyper for myself this time :)
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these top replace my old and trusted Plantronics gaming headset. I read loads and loads of reviews and opted for this set based on price v quality. I am pleased I did. My only observation or criticism is there is too much lead between the headset and the volume control unit and the clip in the volume unit could have been better design for multi fitting situations (ie. the clip should have been on a swivel which would make the leads hang evenly etc). these aside, still worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Dex256

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The sound and mic quality is really good and this headset was very comfortable to wear for long periods. However, the mic now creates a horrible static noise for those that I am talking to. This has made the headset unusable after only 8 months of use. Also, the slider that you can move to mute the mic makes a dreadful sound when moved for the people you are connected to. This slider also became looser and began to automatically slide to it's lowest point after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: W Barnes

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far.
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a while now & still going strong. Sound quality is very good, with deep bass levels & satisfying crisp treble. I my headset for online racing & shooters. The sound effects of engine noise, weaponry & soundtracks are always punchy. Build quality is reassuringly solid, and the ability to turn on & off the mic simply by titling it to a vertical position is excellent. For the price, I’m very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: RichardFaz

customer_reviews.title: Great budget headset.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use on PC, my son loves them. That's good enough for me. 4 stars because there was a noticeable difference in sound and build quality between these and my Astro A50's, but they're a £200 surround sound headset. If your budget is smaller, this is a great headset.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rowbottom

customer_reviews.title: Quality solid gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I like how solid they feel, closed cup, comfortable for prolonged use with interchangeable earpads, mic is acceptable for gaming. There is no default software for equalisation but they sound good as is, very loud with no distortion.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Low Microphone, Waste of money, spend more buy a better headset
customer_reviews.text: Horrible headset, waste of money don’t buy trust me, instantly had multiple issues on both desktop and laptop, was crackly and extremely quiet I have fixed the crackling but the headset mic itself is unbelievably quiet after reading online I see it’s a common problem with these headsets, i don’t know why it had such a high review when it’s a complete waste of money with a mic that is extremely weak. Spend more buy a better headset
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros Great sound in the lows,mids & highs Can connect to everything I have, PC, PS4, Xbox one, phone Comfortable, very comfortable Light on the head Different ear cups in the box Cons Nothing 😂
customer_reviews.author: HENNY VENOM

customer_reviews.title: really nice build quality on the cans
customer_reviews.text: i had popping and crackling sounds when playing any audio through these. after updating the firmware to REV5, that was fixed but the overall volume was lowered and the beeping sound when changing volume etc was gone. really nice build quality on the cans. very comfortable to wear i feel the audio lacks bass though. i see no way to bass boost in windows 10 using these headphones. although inferior build quality, i actually prefer using the sony wireless headset 2.0 because of its great sounding bass.
customer_reviews.author: D. Counter

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this expecting it to have an awesome quality as my housemate has one but I was left disappointed as the first headset the wire was not working well as anytime you moved it you would hear a static noise like it was broken and when i checked my housemates one, it didnt produce that sound. Requested a replacement to check if it could be improved but this one was even worse, you can only hear from the left side of the headset, and again the static noise would be heard. Disappointed, will be returning both and looking for other gaming headsets to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: high quality headset, great for games and communication.
customer_reviews.text: Great High quality and premium feeling product and packaging.However the small included mix amp is plastic and cheap looking along with the controls in my opinion being pointless when using a keyboard with volume controls.It is Easy to setup and configure on PC, no idea how easy it is on consoles. In my opinion the 7.1 virtual surround sound option just makes the sound echo and would recommend keeping it off. Instead using a program such as Nahimic to control this. With this setup the surround sound is amazing and a big upgrade from my Razer kraken 7.1
customer_reviews.author: Remy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best headset I've ever had and for £40 quid it is simply awesome, booming bass and snappy gunshots while playing video games, great sound, and a pretty decent mic, and the swivel to mute function of the mic is certainly my favourite feature. The pay are also very comfortable, they encase your whole ear so they rest on your head properly instead of your ears which is much more comfortable than previous headsets I've had. Genuinely a solid product and great value
customer_reviews.author: Ben Felgate

customer_reviews.title: Were perfect until a week ago
customer_reviews.text: Were perfect until a week ago. After 8 months of in door use the connectivity has broken and I can now only get sound through one side.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Warner

product_meta.title: HyperX HX-HSCS-BK/EM Cloud Stinger Gaming Headset for PC/Xbox/PS4

BOX CONTAINS
1 x HX-HSCS-BK/EM

See more
feature_bullets: Lightweight headset with 90 Degree rotating ear cups
50 mm directional drivers for audio precision, HyperX signature memory foam and adjustable steel slider, intuitive volume control on headset ear cup, Swivel-to-mute noise-cancellation microphone

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars11,566 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
